newsitem.title: USA: InaCom says strong demand continues in '97.
newsitem.headline: InaCom says strong demand continues in '97.

text.p: InaCom Corp, which posted record fourth-quarter and year-end results, said Wednesday all sectors of its business showed consistent growth and it sees demand continuing into the new year.
"During 1996 revenue growth from technology products was up 41 percent, services grew by 43 percent and communications by 39 percent," said president Bill Fairfield in a statement.
The executive added that InaCom's recent consulting acquisitions will support growth in 1997.
"We have not experienced any slowdown in the demand for computer and telecommunications products and services from our business clients," Fairfield said.
Chief financial officer David Guenthner said in a statement the company's vendors "did a good job of making sure we had the products to meet our clients' needs."
Guenthner said that, during the fourth quarter, the company added service professionals and technical support staff, which resulted in an increase in SG&A expenses.

InaCom reported fourth-quarter earnings, including acquisition charges, rose to $0.56 a primary share from $0.43. For the year, they gained to $1.76 from $1.14. Revenues were $920.7 million, up from $656.2 million in the quarter, and $3.10 billion, up from $2.20 billion for the year.
InaCom markets information technology products such as microcomputer systems, work stations and telecommunications equipment.
